abstract: Pennsylvania’s two largest health insurers agreed on Wednesday to merge in a deal that had been in the works for years and gives the two nonprofits control over most of the state’s health insurance market. The boards of Independence Blue Cross of Philadelphia and Highmark of Pittsburgh separately approved a merger that would create the nation’s third-largest health insurer behind the UnitedHealth Group and Wellpoint.
lead_paragraph: Pennsylvania’s two largest health insurers agreed on Wednesday to merge in a deal that had been in the works for years and gives the two nonprofits control over most of the state’s health insurance market. The boards of Independence Blue Cross of Philadelphia and Highmark of Pittsburgh separately approved a merger that would create the nation’s third-largest health insurer behind the UnitedHealth Group and Wellpoint.

headline.main: Pennsylvania Merger Creates Giant Health Insurer
